definition: to peep at/to spy on/to peek

sentences.english: The ritual displays the custom of ancestor worship of the Yi people.
sentences.chinese: 從殺年豬的儀式可以窺視到彝族原始崇拜的一角。

sentences.english: All gun-ports were open and the muzzles peeped wickedly from them.
sentences.chinese: 船上的炮眼開着，炮口虎視眈眈地向外窺視着。

sentences.english: Look through the door's peephole before opening your door.
sentences.chinese: 在開門之前，在門口的窺視孔看下。

sentences.english: The trees like the longings of the earth stand a tiptoe to peep at the heaven.
sentences.chinese: 綠樹彷彿在表示對大地的渴望，踮起腳尖，窺視天空。

sentences.english: After a deep sleep the weeping sweeper keeps on peeping the sheep on the steep.
sentences.chinese: 酣睡之後哭泣的清掃者繼續窺視峭擺上的羊。

sentences.english: 27-13. All gun-ports were open and themuzzles peeped wickedly from them.
sentences.chinese: 船上的炮眼都開着，炮口虎視眈眈地向外窺視着。

sentences.english: A Decken's sifaka peers out from a jagged stone maw.
sentences.chinese: 從一處鋸齒狀的石頭缺口處向外窺視。
芬趴在房門口往裏窺視。

sentences.english: The software giant is itching to buy the web portal he co-founded 13 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 微軟這個軟件業的巨頭對這家門戶網站窺視已久。

sentences.english: Look through the door’s peephole before opening your door.
sentences.chinese: 在開門之前，在門口的窺視孔看下。

sentences.english: We perforce took our peeps at nature from behind the barriers.
sentences.chinese: 我們只好從柵欄裏面往外窺視自然。
他眯起眼睛靠近窺視孔看了看。

sentences.english: He squatted down to peep into the basket.
sentences.chinese: 他蹲下來向籃子裏窺視了一下。

sentences.english: The boot peeked in to see if the shoe was okay.
sentences.chinese: 長筒靴悄悄窺視那鞋子是否還好。

sentences.english: Make sure your front door has a peephole at a level that everyone in the family can see through.
sentences.chinese: 一定要讓前門裝一個家裏人人都能夠得着的窺視孔。

sentences.english: She kept peering through the side curtain.
sentences.chinese: 她不時地從旁邊的幕帳向外窺視。

definition: to pry into or spy on/to snoop/to peep/to poke one's nose into/to peer/to get a glimpse of
to extend one's head (out or into)/a probe/detector/search unit
to peep/to peek/to act as voyeur
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
